isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3406B -1991 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - Cruise Control System

svcproc.title: Cruise Control System
svcproc.para: Refer to Operator Manual for operation instructions.

Service Brake Switch - The service brake switch is closed with the brake pedal released and receives a signal from the ECM (terminal G) on circuit 97Z. The ground (circuit 97AL) for the brake switch goes to the clutch switch.

Clutch Switch - The clutch switch is wired as normally open and adjusted to be closed when the clutch pedal is released. The clutch switch receives a signal from the ECM (terminal G) through the brake switch and is grounded (circuit 97-GE/11-GG) at J7.
Cruise On/Off Switch (153) - The cruise on/off switch receives a signal from the ECM (terminal F) on circuit 97AE. When the switch is in the ON position the ground path is 97-GH/97-GD/11-GG to J7.
Cruise Set/Resume Switch (154) - The selector switch receives a signal from ECM terminals J (set position) and H (resume position) and is grounded at J7.

Vehicle Speed Buffer (160) - The vehicle speed buffer receives 12 volt battery power from the Run Relay (when activated) on circuit 97AD. The speed buffer also receives a signal from the ECM (terminal B) on circuit 47D. Circuit 97-GB goes to ground at J7. The speed buffer receives an AC signal from the vehicle speed sensor.

Vehicle Speed Sensor - The vehicle speed sensor is a dual coil sensor with two pair of leads. One pair connects to the speed buffer and the other is connected to the vehicle speedometer circuits (47E & 47C). The resistance of the two coils in the sensor is different, but the two leads are interchangeable. The resistance of one coil must be 900-1100 ohms. The resistance of the other coil must be 1200-1450 ohms.

Throttle Position Sensor (158) -The throttle position sensor receives a signal from the ECM (terminal E) on circuit 99. The throttle position sensor receives battery power from the Run Relay (when activated) on circuit 97R and circuit 97-GK goes to ground at J7.
